cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: expected to drift north-northwest today, then accelerate west-northwest Monday and turn northwest across the Gulf toward the northern Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch in effect Tulum to Rio Lagartos, Mexico including Cozumel
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning in effect Pinar del Río, Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward to Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) likely Wednesday; hurricane-force gusts possible if Zeta reaches Category 1 strength before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential storm surge greater than 3 ft along the lower Mississippi River Delta including Plaquemines Parish.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher amounts possible, producing flash-flood risk near the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands and short-fuse river rises along the lower Mississippi River.
